oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tandy Rice Interviewed by Bob Allen in 1980
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Allen interviewing Tandy Rice. The recording takes place on 09-19-1980.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tandy Rice
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:00) -- First seven minutes of tape are Tandy Rice speaking to others in his office and on the phone. Tandy hangs up his call at 6:51. (7:16) -- Tandy Rice speaks about Jim Ed Brown's personal life. (7:56) -- Bob Allen asks Tandy Rice about the potential of Top Billing. (8:27) -- Tandy Rice speaks about Top Billing's lack of a mega-superstar. (9:04) -- Tandy Rice describes how Top Billing's agents are "dream merchants." (10:24) -- "You know It's possible Bob, to take a wrong idea, and score a touchdown with it." - Tandy Rice. (11:58) -- Tandy Rice describes how a company creates superstars - buying or building. (13:33) -- Tandy Rice projects and describes the future of Top Billing. (14:05) -- Tandy Rice describes the success of Top Billing since he first purchased it in 1971. (16:14) -- Tandy Rice speaks about a potential conflict between Roy Clark and The Oak Ridge Boys. (18:25) -- Tandy Rice speaks about his Rolex Presidential watch. (19:49) -- Tandy Rice speaks about Opryland. (21:29) -- Bob Allen asks Tandy Rice about his reputation for being able to pull business into Top Billing. (25:50) -- Interview resumes after interruption from co-worker. (26:01) -- Bob Allen asks Tandy Rice about whether he considers himself a "three-piece suit guy in a blue jean business." Tandy Rice goes on to describe his mentality of running Top Billing.
